content: Insurance Asked by AnonymousAsked on 06 Aug 2018How to get insurance for patients with pre-existing medical conditions/illnesses/disability?I understand that the point of insurance is to insure our savings from being dry during a crisis. But at the same time, it make sense to have an insurance to prevent crisis from further escalating. However, I cannot find such agents who offer such products.I am a dialysis patient and looking for ways to afford my ridiculously expensive medical bills.3 answersAnswerBump0

Eric Chia, Senior Financial Consultant at PrudentialLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 08 Aug 2018Insurance is something ironically that you can buy when you don't need, and when you need it you can't buy it anymore.​Prudential and AIA is giving folks like yourself a second chance. Here's the links to the products: Prudential's PruVital Cover - https://www.prudential.com.sg/en/our-solutions/products/pruvital-cover/AIA's Diabetes Care - https://www.aia.com.sg/en/our-products/critical-illness-protection/aia-diabetes-care.html0 comments1

Charmaine NgLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 06 Aug 2018Hi, I'm sorry to hear..I'm sure you already know most insurers will exclude your pre-existing medical illnesses.​What I can think of is tapping onto the group health insurance with your company and if you are a Singaporean receiving subsidized treatment at a medifund approved instituions but still having difficulties; to make the payments; you may want to contact for medifund assistance.​https://www.moh.gov.sg/content/moh_web/home/costs_and_financing/schemes_subsidies/Medifund.html​Apart from that, you may want to get coverage for yourself for other possible scenarios.. note that the premiums will definitely be higher as you will be considered high risk profile.​Hope this helps!0 comments1
